metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9721 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
libzmq before 4.0.6 and 4.1.x before 4.1.1 allows remote attackers to conduct downgrade attacks and bypass ZMTP v3 protocol security mechanisms via a ZMTP v2 or earlier header. It was discovered that ZeroMQ mishandled certain input. A remote, unauthenticated attacker could use this vulnerability to bypass ZeroMQs security mechanisms.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9721` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzmq5 - 4.0.5+dfsg-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zeromq3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.5+dfsg-3').
